detaileddescription.para: Get the current state of a POV hat on a joystick.
The returned value will be one of the following positions:

parameterdescription.para: an SDL_Joystick structure containing joystick information
the hat index to get the state from; indices start at index 0

simplesect.para: the current hat position.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the ball axis change since the last poll.
Trackballs can only return relative motion since the last call to SDL_JoystickGetBall(), these motion deltas are placed into dx and dy.
Most joysticks do not have trackballs.

parameterdescription.para: the SDL_Joystick to query
the ball index to query; ball indices start at index 0
stores the difference in the x axis position since the last poll
stores the difference in the y axis position since the last poll

simplesect.para: 0 on success or a negative error code on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current state of a button on a joystick.

parameterdescription.para: an SDL_Joystick structure containing joystick information
the button index to get the state from; indices start at index 0

simplesect.para: 1 if the specified button is pressed, 0 otherwise.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

memberdef.argsstring: (SDL_Joystick *joystick, Uint16 low_frequency_rumble, Uint16 high_frequency_rumble, Uint32 duration_ms)
memberdef.name: SDL_JoystickRumble

detaileddescription.para: Start a rumble effect.
Each call to this function cancels any previous rumble effect, and calling it with 0 intensity stops any rumbling.

parameterdescription.para: The joystick to vibrate
The intensity of the low frequency (left) rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF
The intensity of the high frequency (right) rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF
The duration of the rumble effect, in milliseconds

simplesect.para: 0, or -1 if rumble isn't supported on this joystick
This function is available since SDL 2.0.9.

memberdef.argsstring: (SDL_Joystick *joystick, Uint16 left_rumble, Uint16 right_rumble, Uint32 duration_ms)
memberdef.name: SDL_JoystickRumbleTriggers

detaileddescription.para: Start a rumble effect in the joystick's triggers
Each call to this function cancels any previous trigger rumble effect, and calling it with 0 intensity stops any rumbling.

Note that this function is for trigger rumble; the first joystick to support this was the PlayStation 5's DualShock 5 controller. If you want the (more common) whole-controller rumble, use SDL_JoystickRumble() instead.

parameterdescription.para: The joystick to vibrate
The intensity of the left trigger rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF
The intensity of the right trigger rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF
The duration of the rumble effect, in milliseconds

simplesect.para: 0, or -1 if trigger rumble isn't supported on this joystick
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Query whether a joystick has an LED.
An example of a joystick LED is the light on the back of a PlayStation 4's DualShock 4 controller.

parameterdescription.para: The joystick to query

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE if the joystick has a modifiable LED, SDL_FALSE otherwise.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Query whether a joystick has rumble support.

parameterdescription.para: The joystick to query

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE if the joystick has rumble, SDL_FALSE otherwise.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.18.

detaileddescription.para: Query whether a joystick has rumble support on triggers.

parameterdescription.para: The joystick to query

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE if the joystick has trigger rumble, SDL_FALSE otherwise.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.18.

memberdef.argsstring: (SDL_Joystick *joystick, Uint8 red, Uint8 green, Uint8 blue)
memberdef.name: SDL_JoystickSetLED

detaileddescription.para: Update a joystick's LED color.
An example of a joystick LED is the light on the back of a PlayStation 4's DualShock 4 controller.

parameterdescription.para: The joystick to update
The intensity of the red LED
The intensity of the green LED
The intensity of the blue LED

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 if this joystick does not have a modifiable LED
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Send a joystick specific effect packet

parameterdescription.para: The joystick to affect
The data to send to the joystick
The size of the data to send to the joystick

simplesect.para: 0, or -1 if this joystick or driver doesn't support effect packets
This function is available since SDL 2.0.16.

detaileddescription.para: Close a joystick previously opened with SDL_JoystickOpen().

parameterdescription.para: The joystick device to close

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the battery level of a joystick as SDL_JoystickPowerLevel.

parameterdescription.para: the SDL_Joystick to query

simplesect.para: the current battery level as SDL_JoystickPowerLevel on success or SDL_JOYSTICK_POWER_UNKNOWN if it is unknown
This function is available since SDL 2.0.4.

detaileddescription.para: This is a unique ID for a joystick for the time it is connected to the system, and is never reused for the lifetime of the application. If the joystick is disconnected and reconnected, it will get a new ID.
The ID value starts at 0 and increments from there. The value -1 is an invalid ID.
Locking for multi-threaded access to the joystick API
If you are using the joystick API or handling events from multiple threads you should use these locking functions to protect access to the joysticks.
In particular, you are guaranteed that the joystick list won't change, so the API functions that take a joystick index will be valid, and joystick and game controller events will not be delivered.

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.7.

detaileddescription.para: Unlocking for multi-threaded access to the joystick API
If you are using the joystick API or handling events from multiple threads you should use these locking functions to protect access to the joysticks.
In particular, you are guaranteed that the joystick list won't change, so the API functions that take a joystick index will be valid, and joystick and game controller events will not be delivered.

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.7.

detaileddescription.para: Count the number of joysticks attached to the system.

simplesect.para: the number of attached joysticks on success or a negative error code on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the implementation dependent name of a joystick.
This can be called before any joysticks are opened.

parameterdescription.para: the index of the joystick to query (the N'th joystick on the system)

simplesect.para: the name of the selected joystick. If no name can be found, this function returns NULL; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the player index of a joystick, or -1 if it's not available This can be called before any joysticks are opened.

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.9.

detaileddescription.para: Get the implementation-dependent GUID for the joystick at a given device index.
This function can be called before any joysticks are opened.

parameterdescription.para: the index of the joystick to query (the N'th joystick on the system

simplesect.para: the GUID of the selected joystick. If called on an invalid index, this function returns a zero GUID
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the USB vendor ID of a joystick, if available.
This can be called before any joysticks are opened. If the vendor ID isn't available this function returns 0.

parameterdescription.para: the index of the joystick to query (the N'th joystick on the system

simplesect.para: the USB vendor ID of the selected joystick. If called on an invalid index, this function returns zero
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Get the USB product ID of a joystick, if available.
This can be called before any joysticks are opened. If the product ID isn't available this function returns 0.

parameterdescription.para: the index of the joystick to query (the N'th joystick on the system

simplesect.para: the USB product ID of the selected joystick. If called on an invalid index, this function returns zero
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Get the product version of a joystick, if available.
This can be called before any joysticks are opened. If the product version isn't available this function returns 0.

parameterdescription.para: the index of the joystick to query (the N'th joystick on the system

simplesect.para: the product version of the selected joystick. If called on an invalid index, this function returns zero
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Get the type of a joystick, if available.
This can be called before any joysticks are opened.

parameterdescription.para: the index of the joystick to query (the N'th joystick on the system

simplesect.para: the SDL_JoystickType of the selected joystick. If called on an invalid index, this function returns SDL_JOYSTICK_TYPE_UNKNOWN
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Get the instance ID of a joystick.
This can be called before any joysticks are opened. If the index is out of range, this function will return -1.

parameterdescription.para: the index of the joystick to query (the N'th joystick on the system

simplesect.para: the instance id of the selected joystick. If called on an invalid index, this function returns zero
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Open a joystick for use.

The device_index argument refers to the N'th joystick presently recognized by SDL on the system. It is NOT the same as the instance ID used to identify the joystick in future events. See SDL_JoystickInstanceID() for more details about instance IDs.
The joystick subsystem must be initialized before a joystick can be opened for use.

parameterdescription.para: the index of the joystick to query

simplesect.para: a joystick identifier or NULL if an error occurred; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the SDL_Joystick associated with an instance id.

parameterdescription.para: the instance id to get the SDL_Joystick for

simplesect.para: an SDL_Joystick on success or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.4.

detaileddescription.para: Get the SDL_Joystick associated with a player index.

parameterdescription.para: the player index to get the SDL_Joystick for

simplesect.para: an SDL_Joystick on success or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.12.

memberdef.argsstring: (SDL_JoystickType type, int naxes, int nbuttons, int nhats)
memberdef.name: SDL_JoystickAttachVirtual

detaileddescription.para: Attach a new virtual joystick.

simplesect.para: the joystick's device index, or -1 if an error occurred.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Detach a virtual joystick.

parameterdescription.para: a value previously returned from SDL_JoystickAttachVirtual()

simplesect.para: 0 on success, or -1 if an error occurred.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Query whether or not the joystick at a given device index is virtual.

parameterdescription.para: a joystick device index.

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE if the joystick is virtual, SDL_FALSE otherwise.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Set values on an opened, virtual-joystick's axis.

Please note that values set here will not be applied until the next call to SDL_JoystickUpdate, which can either be called directly, or can be called indirectly through various other SDL APIs, including, but not limited to the following: SDL_PollEvent, SDL_PumpEvents, SDL_WaitEventTimeout, SDL_WaitEvent.

parameterdescription.para: the virtual joystick on which to set state.
the specific axis on the virtual joystick to set.
the new value for the specified axis.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Set values on an opened, virtual-joystick's button.

Please note that values set here will not be applied until the next call to SDL_JoystickUpdate, which can either be called directly, or can be called indirectly through various other SDL APIs, including, but not limited to the following: SDL_PollEvent, SDL_PumpEvents, SDL_WaitEventTimeout, SDL_WaitEvent.

parameterdescription.para: the virtual joystick on which to set state.
the specific button on the virtual joystick to set.
the new value for the specified button.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Set values on an opened, virtual-joystick's hat.

Please note that values set here will not be applied until the next call to SDL_JoystickUpdate, which can either be called directly, or can be called indirectly through various other SDL APIs, including, but not limited to the following: SDL_PollEvent, SDL_PumpEvents, SDL_WaitEventTimeout, SDL_WaitEvent.

parameterdescription.para: the virtual joystick on which to set state.
the specific hat on the virtual joystick to set.
the new value for the specified hat.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

For XInput controllers this returns the XInput user index. Many joysticks will not be able to supply this information.

simplesect.para: the player index, or -1 if it's not available.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.9.

the player index to set.

This function requires an open joystick.

parameterdescription.para: the SDL_Joystick obtained from SDL_JoystickOpen()

simplesect.para: the GUID of the given joystick. If called on an invalid index, this function returns a zero GUID; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the USB vendor ID of an opened joystick, if available.
If the vendor ID isn't available this function returns 0.

simplesect.para: the USB vendor ID of the selected joystick, or 0 if unavailable.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Get the USB product ID of an opened joystick, if available.
If the product ID isn't available this function returns 0.

parameterdescription.para: the SDL_Joystick obtained from SDL_JoystickOpen()

simplesect.para: the USB product ID of the selected joystick, or 0 if unavailable.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Get the product version of an opened joystick, if available.
If the product version isn't available this function returns 0.

parameterdescription.para: the SDL_Joystick obtained from SDL_JoystickOpen()

simplesect.para: the product version of the selected joystick, or 0 if unavailable.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Get the serial number of an opened joystick, if available.
Returns the serial number of the joystick, or NULL if it is not available.

parameterdescription.para: the SDL_Joystick obtained from SDL_JoystickOpen()

simplesect.para: the serial number of the selected joystick, or NULL if unavailable.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Get the type of an opened joystick.

parameterdescription.para: the SDL_Joystick obtained from SDL_JoystickOpen()

simplesect.para: the SDL_JoystickType of the selected joystick.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Get an ASCII string representation for a given SDL_JoystickGUID.
You should supply at least 33 bytes for pszGUID.

parameterdescription.para: the SDL_JoystickGUID you wish to convert to string
buffer in which to write the ASCII string
the size of pszGUID

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Convert a GUID string into a SDL_JoystickGUID structure.
Performs no error checking. If this function is given a string containing an invalid GUID, the function will silently succeed, but the GUID generated will not be useful.

parameterdescription.para: string containing an ASCII representation of a GUID

simplesect.para: a SDL_JoystickGUID structure.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the status of a specified joystick.

parameterdescription.para: the joystick to query

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE if the joystick has been opened, SDL_FALSE if it has not; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the instance ID of an opened joystick.

parameterdescription.para: an SDL_Joystick structure containing joystick information

simplesect.para: the instance ID of the specified joystick on success or a negative error code on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the number of general axis controls on a joystick.
Often, the directional pad on a game controller will either look like 4 separate buttons or a POV hat, and not axes, but all of this is up to the device and platform.

parameterdescription.para: an SDL_Joystick structure containing joystick information

simplesect.para: the number of axis controls/number of axes on success or a negative error code on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the number of trackballs on a joystick.
Joystick trackballs have only relative motion events associated with them and their state cannot be polled.
Most joysticks do not have trackballs.

parameterdescription.para: an SDL_Joystick structure containing joystick information

simplesect.para: the number of trackballs on success or a negative error code on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the number of POV hats on a joystick.

parameterdescription.para: an SDL_Joystick structure containing joystick information

simplesect.para: the number of POV hats on success or a negative error code on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the number of buttons on a joystick.

parameterdescription.para: an SDL_Joystick structure containing joystick information

simplesect.para: the number of buttons on success or a negative error code on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Update the current state of the open joysticks.
This is called automatically by the event loop if any joystick events are enabled.

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Enable/disable joystick event polling.
If joystick events are disabled, you must call SDL_JoystickUpdate() yourself and manually check the state of the joystick when you want joystick information.
It is recommended that you leave joystick event handling enabled.
WARNING: Calling this function may delete all events currently in SDL's event queue.

state
can be one of SDL_QUERY, SDL_IGNORE, or SDL_ENABLE
1 if enabled, 0 if disabled, or a negative error code on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
If state is SDL_QUERY then the current state is returned, otherwise the new processing state is returned.

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current state of an axis control on a joystick.

SDL makes no promises about what part of the joystick any given axis refers to. Your game should have some sort of configuration UI to let users specify what each axis should be bound to. Alternately, SDL's higher-level Game Controller API makes a great effort to apply order to this lower-level interface, so you know that a specific axis is the "left thumb stick," etc.

The value returned by SDL_JoystickGetAxis() is a signed integer (-32768 to 32767) representing the current position of the axis. It may be necessary to impose certain tolerances on these values to account for jitter.

parameterdescription.para: an SDL_Joystick structure containing joystick information
the axis to query; the axis indices start at index 0

simplesect.para: a 16-bit signed integer representing the current position of the axis or 0 on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the initial state of an axis control on a joystick.
The state is a value ranging from -32768 to 32767.
The axis indices start at index 0.

parameterdescription.para: an SDL_Joystick structure containing joystick information
the axis to query; the axis indices start at index 0
Upon return, the initial value is supplied here.

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE if this axis has any initial value, or SDL_FALSE if not.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Include file for SDL joystick event handling

The term "device_index" identifies currently plugged in joystick devices between 0 and SDL_NumJoysticks(), with the exact joystick behind a device_index changing as joysticks are plugged and unplugged.

The term "instance_id" is the current instantiation of a joystick device in the system, if the joystick is removed and then re-inserted then it will get a new instance_id, instance_id's are monotonically increasing identifiers of a joystick plugged in.

The term "player_index" is the number assigned to a player on a specific controller. For XInput controllers this returns the XInput user index. Many joysticks will not be able to supply this information.

The term JoystickGUID is a stable 128-bit identifier for a joystick device that does not change over time, it identifies class of the device (a X360 wired controller for example). This identifier is platform dependent.
In order to use these functions, SDL_Init() must have been called with the SDL_INIT_JOYSTICK flag. This causes SDL to scan the system for joysticks, and load appropriate drivers.
If you would like to receive joystick updates while the application is in the background, you should set the following hint before calling SDL_Init(): SDL_HINT_JOYSTICK_ALLOW_BACKGROUND_EVENTS
